articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Militant group Hamas said it was ready to begin talks on the second phase of a ceasefire in Gaza after several hundred Palestinians were released from Israeli jails overnight in return for the bodies of four Israeli hostages.
articles.title: Hamas says it's ready for more ceasefire talks after prisoner exchange

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry on Thursday reported a surge in Chinese military activity the previous day, but officials said they did not detect any live-fire exercises in a drill zone off the island's southwestern coast.
articles.title: Taiwan details surge in Chinese military activity, did not detect live fire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The talks are aimed at resolving disputes over the work of their respective embassies.
articles.title: Russian delegation arrives for talks with US in Istanbul

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday announced a reversal of concessions given to Venezuela by his predecessor Joe Biden more than two years ago.
articles.title: Trump orders termination of oil deal with Venezuela

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Internet personality Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan left Romania on a private flight for the United States early on Thursday, news website G4media.ro said citing airport sources.
articles.title: Internet celebrity Andrew Tate leaves Romania-report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of babies born in Japan fell to a record low of 720,988 in 2024 for a ninth consecutive year of decline, the health ministry said on Thursday, underscoring the rapid ageing and dwindling of the population.
articles.title: Japan's births fell to record low in 2024

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Thursday that it believed dialogue with the United States should move forward as long as there is political will on both sides and a readiness to listen to each other, but said nobody expected quick and easy solutions.
articles.title: Kremlin says dialogue with US should move forward but nobody expects quick solutions

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Ukraine said on Wednesday it was set to approve a framework minerals deal with the United States but that its success would depend on talks with President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Ukraine set to sign minerals deal, Trump confirms Zelenskiy visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Antonio Ferrara - a notorious French criminal and bank robber dubbed the 'jailbreak king' - has been arrested following co-operation with Belgian authorities, said French interior minister Bruno Retailleau on Thursday.
articles.title: Notorious French criminal Antonio Ferrara - dubbed 'jailbreak king' - arrested

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The EU Court of Justice should rule in favour of Austria in its appeal against the European Commission's decision to approve Hungary's state aid for the expansion of its Paks atomic plant, the court's adviser said on Thursday.
articles.title: EU top court should rule against Hungary's nuclear state aid, adviser says
